episodes.description: Kirk and his crew are at deadly risk from an alien creature that feeds on the salt in a human body and can take on any form.
episodes.title: The Man Trap

episodes.description: Captain Kirk must learn the limits to the power of a 17-year-old boy with the psychic ability to create anything and destroy anyone.
episodes.title: Charlie X

episodes.description: While exploring the edge of the galaxy, the Enterprise encounters an energy barrier that gives two crewmen godlike powers.
episodes.title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

episodes.description: A strange alien substance causes the crew to act out their deepest inhibitions, while the ship plummets out of orbit.
episodes.title: The Naked Time

episodes.description: A transporter malfunction causes Captain Kirk to split into his "good" and "evil" selves, and a landing party will freeze to death if they don't merge the two back together.
episodes.title: The Enemy Within

episodes.description: The Enterprise picks up a intergalactic conman, Harry Mudd, and three incredibly beautiful women who harbor a dark secret.
episodes.title: Mudd's Women

episodes.description: Nurse Christine Chapel is reunited with her old fiance on Exo III, but the scientist has plans for Captain Kirk and the Federation.
episodes.title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

episodes.description: Kirk and a landing party are stranded on a planet due to a disease that causes any adult to die a painful death, and must deal with the local children who have survived.
episodes.title: Miri

episodes.description: Kirk investigates an experimental facility for holding prisoners and finds a sinister scheme.
episodes.title: Dagger of the Mind

episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a vast alien ship that sets out to test them.
episodes.title: The Corbomite Maneuver

episodes.description: Spock kidnaps his former captain, the crippled Christopher Pike, and heads for a quarantined planet, putting his career and Kirk's life on the line.
episodes.title: The Menagerie (1)

episodes.description: Spock's court-martial continues as he attempts to justify his abduction of Pike, the theft of the Enterprise, and his heading for a planet declared forbidden by Starfleet.
episodes.title: The Menagerie (2)

episodes.description: Kirk is one of the last survivors who can identify a mass killer, who lurks among a Shakespearean troupe aboard the Enterprise.
episodes.title: The Conscience of the King

episodes.description: Kirk pits the Enterprise against an invisible spaceship testing the Federation's defenses.
episodes.title: Balance of Terror

episodes.description: The Enterprise crew take shore leave on a peaceful, pastoral planet...where their dreams and fantasies come to life.
episodes.title: Shore Leave

episodes.description: Spock  commands a stranded away team when their shuttlecraft is stranded on a planet with hostile natives.
episodes.title: The Galileo Seven

episodes.description: The Enterprise finds itself at the mercy of a seemingly omnipotent being who fancies himself a 18th century Englishman.
episodes.title: The Squire of Gothos

episodes.description: When a mysterious alien race destroy an Earth colony, the Enterprise pursues but Kirk and the alien captain are forced to fight each other by powerful aliens.
episodes.title: Arena

episodes.description: The Enterprise collides with a black hole and is thrown back to Earth in the 20th century, where they must find a way back and erase any trace of their presence. Matters become complicated when they rescue an Air Force pilot and cannot return him without changing history...but if he disappears that will change history as well.
episodes.title: Tomorrow Is Yesterday

episodes.description: Captain Kirk's career is at stake when he is put on trial for the loss of a crewman during an ion storm.
episodes.title: Court Martial

episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a seemingly peaceful civilization run by a ""benevolent"" being named Landru...who intends for them to join his people.
episodes.title: The Return of the Archons

episodes.description: The Enterprise picks up a crew of genetic supermen from the 20th century...and their leader, Khan, plans to create a new empire.
episodes.title: Space Seed

episodes.description: The Enterprise arrives at a planet to establish diplomatic relations and finds itself in the middle of a "peaceful" war that threatens to destroy the ship.
episodes.title: A Taste of Armageddon

episodes.description: The Enterprise crew is trapped in paradise when they come to rescue colonists who have fallen to pacifying alien spores and become infected themselves.
episodes.title: This Side of Paradise

episodes.description: Kirk investigates a series of grisly murders on a mining planet that are the work of a seemingly hostile alien creature.
episodes.title: The Devil in the Dark

episodes.description: The Federation and the Klingon Empire teeter on the brink of war as Kirk investigates a humble planet caught in the middle - Organia, inhabited by pacifists
episodes.title: Errand of Mercy

episodes.description: Kirk and Spock encounter an alien named Lazarus who claims to be from an anti-matter universe.
episodes.title: The Alternative Factor

episodes.description: Kirk and Spock must travel into the past in order to correct a change that will alter history.
episodes.title: The City on the Edge of Forever

episodes.description: Kirk and the Enterprise must combat parasitic aliens.
episodes.title: Operation: Annihilate!

episodes.description: First Officer Spock returns to his home world for a brutal Vulcan mating ritual.
episodes.title: Amok Time

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise are held captive by an alien who turns out to be the Greek god Apollo.
episodes.title: Who Mourns for Adonais?

episodes.description: The crew of the USS Enterprise deals with an indestructible planet-destroying space probe.
episodes.title: The Changeling

episodes.description: A transporter mishap swaps Captain Kirk and his companions with their evil counterparts in a parallel universe. In the so-called Mirror Universe, the Enterprise is a ship of the Terran Empire, an organization as evil as the United Federation of Planets is benevolent.
episodes.title: Mirror, Mirror

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise visits a mysterious paradisical planet controlled by a computer that is served by the local inhabitants.
episodes.title: The Apple

episodes.description: The starship Enterprise and its heavily-damaged sister ship, the USS Constellation, must work together to stop an alien planet-killing machine headed for the heart of Federation territory.
episodes.title: The Doomsday Machine

episodes.description: Two powerful aliens threaten the well-being of the Enterprise and her crew.
episodes.title: Catspaw

episodes.description: Captain Kirk has a second run-in with the conman, Harry Mudd. Mudd is now the supreme ruler of a planet of androids who cater to his every whim.
episodes.title: I, Mudd

episodes.description: A shuttle crew from the USS Enterprise encounters a man out of history and his mysterious alien companion.
episodes.title: Metamorphosis

episodes.description: The Enterprise must transport dignitaries to a peace conference, with an assassin on the loose.
episodes.title: Journey to Babel

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise become entangled in a planet's tribal power struggle.
episodes.title: Friday's Child

episodes.description: Strange radiation exposes the command crew of the Enterprise to the effects of rapid aging.
episodes.title: The Deadly Years

episodes.description: Captain James T. Kirk becomes obsessed with destroying a deadly entity he once encountered in his youth.
episodes.title: Obsession

episodes.description: A series of bizarre murders points to Mr. Scott as the prime suspect.
episodes.title: Wolf in the Fold

episodes.description: The ship travels to Deep Space Station K7 to guard a consignment of grain bound for Sherman's Planet. On arrival, a trader named Cyrano Jones gives Lt. Uhura a tribble, with dramatic consequences. Kirk and the crew also have to deal with the arrival of Captain Koloth and his Klingon battlecruiser, but the tribbles unexpectedly reveal a plot to poison the grain.
episodes.title: The Trouble With Tribbles

episodes.description: Captain Kirk and his companions are abducted into slavery and trained to fight as gladiators for the gambling entertainment of three disembodied beings.
episodes.title: The Gamesters of Triskelion

episodes.description: The Enterprise visits a planet with an Earth-like 1920s gangster culture, with Runyonesque dialog and costumes.
episodes.title: A Piece of the Action

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise encounters an energy-draining space creature.
episodes.title: The Immunity Syndrome

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise discovers Klingon interference in the development of a formerly peaceful planet and joins them in what becomes an arms race.
episodes.title: A Private Little War

episodes.description: Telepathic aliens take control of Captain Kirk's and First Officer Spock's bodies.
episodes.title: Return to Tomorrow

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise tracks down a Federation observer on a planet dominated by a "Naziesque" regime.
episodes.title: Patterns of Force

episodes.description: Beings from another galaxy commandeer the Enterprise in an attempt to return home.
episodes.title: By Any Other Name

episodes.description: Captain Kirk must find the cure to a deadly disease and put an end to another Starfleet captain's cultural interference.
episodes.title: The Omega Glory

episodes.description: A skeleton Enterprise crew are assigned to test a revolutionary computer system that is given total control of the ship.
episodes.title: The Ultimate Computer

episodes.description: The Enterprise crew investigates the disappearance of a ship's crew on a planet that is a modern version of the Roman Empire.
episodes.title: Bread and Circuses

episodes.description: While back in time observing Earth in 1968, the Enterprise crew encounters the mysterious Gary Seven who has his own agenda on the planet.
episodes.title: Assignment: Earth

episodes.description: An alien female beams aboard the ship and, after incapacitating the rest of the crew, surgically removes Spock's brain. Kirk and the crew have just hours to locate and replace it before Spock's body dies.
episodes.title: Spock's Brain

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise are on a secret mission to steal a Romulan cloaking device.
episodes.title: The Enterprise Incident

episodes.description: An alien device on a primitive planet erases Captain Kirk's memory, and he begins a new life with the planet's indigenous people.
episodes.title: The Paradise Syndrome

episodes.description: On a distant planet, Kirk, Spock and McCoy find a scientific team dead, and their children who, unknown to the crew, have great powers at their disposal.
episodes.title: And the Children Shall Lead

episodes.description: The Enterprise travels with an alien ambassador whose appearance induces madness.
episodes.title: Is There in Truth No Beauty?

episodes.description: Having been found trespassers into Melkotian space, Captain Kirk and his companions are sent to die in a re-enactment of the gunfight at the O.K. Corral.
episodes.title: Spectre of the Gun

episodes.description: An alien force drives the crew of the Enterprise into brutal conflict with the Klingons.
episodes.title: Day of the Dove

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise rush to stop an asteroid from colliding with a Federation world, but discover the asteroid is actually an inhabited generation ship.
episodes.title: For the World Is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky

episodes.description: Captain Kirk is caught between dimensions while the crew of the Enterprise works to retrieve him. All the while, the Tholians demand that the Enterprise leave their space.
episodes.title: The Tholian Web

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise encounters an ageless and sadistic race of humanoids with the power of telekinesis and who claim to have organized their society around Ancient Greek ideals.
episodes.title: Plato's Stepchildren

episodes.description: Invisible "time-accelerated" aliens take over the Enterprise and attempt to abduct the crew for use as "genetic stock".
episodes.title: Wink of an Eye

episodes.description: While visiting a doomed planet, the landing party is subject to torturous experiments by powerful aliens.
episodes.title: The Empath

episodes.description: The USS Enterprise ferries a spoiled princess whose betrothal to a royal Troyian is hoped will bring peace to a star system at war.
episodes.title: Elaan of Troyius

episodes.description: Captain Kirk faces off with a demented shape-shifting starship captain determined to control the universe.
episodes.title: Whom Gods Destroy

episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters two duo-chromatic and mutually belligerent aliens who put the ship in the middle of their old conflict
episodes.title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield

episodes.description: A race of overpopulated aliens abduct Captain Kirk to solve their problem.
episodes.title: The Mark of Gideon

episodes.description: Kirk, McCoy, and Sulu are stranded on a barren planet where a mysterious woman attempts to kill them one at a time, while the Enterprise must travel halfway across the galaxy to rescue them.
episodes.title: That Which Survives

episodes.description: Strange incorporeal aliens threaten the Memory Alpha station and the Enterprise.
episodes.title: The Lights of Zetar

episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise encounter an immortal human in this science fiction variation on Shakespeare's The Tempest.
episodes.title: Requiem for Methuselah

episodes.description: The Enterprise picks up a group of space ""hippies"" looking for Eden.
episodes.title: The Way to Eden

episodes.description: Captain Kirk races against time to acquire plague-fighting minerals from a world in the midst of a civil uprising against a grievous social class disparity.
episodes.title: The Cloud Minders

episodes.description: Aliens force Captain Kirk and First Officer Spock to join forces with "Abraham Lincoln" and "Surak" to battle villains in a contest of good vs. evil.
episodes.title: The Savage Curtain

episodes.description: Kirk, Spock and McCoy are trapped in two parts of another planet's past—a world threatened with destruction when its sun goes supernova.
episodes.title: All Our Yesterdays

episodes.description: The Enterprise is in danger when Janice Lester, one of Kirk's former lovers, steals his body.
episodes.title: Turnabout Intruder
